events.description: Morning bulletin by Zazu to Mufasa.
events.discussion: Discuss the importance of an audit in a system.

events.description: Mufasa and Simba simulate an attack against Zazu.
events.discussion: Discuss the benefits of a simulation attack, and what needs to be put in place for the simulation to be effective.

events.description: Simba and Nala play social engineering skills to get permission to go to the Elephant’s Graveyard.
Simba and Nala leave their realm and enter a territory not under the protection of the Lion King.
events.discussion: Discuss the dangers of accessing areas with no security.

events.description: Gnus are tricked to run towards the canyon by the hyaenas, causing a dangerous and dramatic situation for Simba.
events.discussion: Discuss the effects of erratic behaviour on the security of the parties involved, and how one should react to a situation in which one’s security is threatened.

events.description: Timon identifies the animal is a lion.
events.discussion: Discuss what mechanism can be used to identify a potential threat or attacker, and the benefits and shortcomings in doing so.

events.description: Flower petals allow Rafiki to realize Simba is alive.
events.discussion: Discuss types of secret communication (from steganography to cryptography), and risks associated to them
